snippet: A federal judge cited the First Amendment in overriding the government’s argument for keeping secret classified tapes showing the forced feeding of a detainee.
abstract: Judge Gladys Kessler of the United States Court for the District of Columbia orders Obama administration to unseal 28 classified military videos showing forced cell extraction and force feeding of hunger-striking Guantanamo Bay detainee Jihad Ahmed Mujstafa Diyab; Kessler, citing First Amendment, rejects Obama administration's arguments that publicly showing videos would endanger national security.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge cited the First Amendment in overriding the government’s argument for keeping secret classified tapes showing the forced feeding of a detainee.

headline.main: Judge Orders Disclosure of Guantánamo Videos
headline.print_headline: Judge Rules on Disclosing Guantánamo Video
